revised_title: Electro-Magnetic Properties of Metalliferous Veins in Cornwall Mines
tldr: The author, Robert Were Fox, investigates the electro-magnetic properties of metalliferous veins in Cornwall mines and discovers that the intensity of electric currents varies with the abundance of copper ore and depth of the veins. He also observes that the electricity in mines is not influenced by the presence of workmen, candles, or explosions. Fox's experiments lead him to propose a connection between heat, electricity, magnetism, and the arrangement of veins in the earth's crust.
